Our monthly employee newsletter with company updates and announcements -----
December 2022 Edition

Welcome to the Latest Edition of 
The Justia Insider

Joy! Joy! Joy! On behalf of The Justia Insider Team, we wish that you receive all the hope, wonder, and joy that the season brings! The Justia Team also wants to thank you for your diligent work and dedication throughout this fantastic year. We have accomplished so much thus far and look forward to another successful year for our company. It’s been quite a year for us all! Let’s make sure next year is just as memorable as 2022. Let the overeating begin!

Milestones & Accomplishments

Let’s Find Out What’s Been Achieved So Far by Our Teams at Justia

Short Videos Production: As an integral part of our content strategy, we have been creating short videos on legal topics. We implemented a process for producing these short videos systematically. Once the short videos are produced, they are posted on our Justia Mexico and Justia MX Office social media accounts.

Justia Daily Opinion Summaries: We refreshed the Justia Daily Opinion Summaries subscribe page with a fresh new look and changes to the backend. The redesign aims to provide an easy-to-use interface and better suggestions to our users and bring more caselaw summary subscribers.

Justia Elevate Updates: We constantly update Justia Elevate to improve our clients' experience. This month we updated our internal Justia Elevate guide, improved documentation of all supported components, included new versions for the Attorneys' stripe, and tweaked our client contact form alerts monitoring process, among many other things.

Justia Connect Updates: Justia Connect is also updated constantly. To mention a few changes, we have a new admin interface for webinar registrants, a newly added sticky footer for anonymous users browsing our webinars section, tags for Justia Legal Deals, and several other changes.

Redesign for JLD Reviews: We redesigned the Attorney to Attorney reviews page and the Client review page. The objective is to provide better context to users of our reviewing process.

US State Regulations: We released the latest quarterly update of the US State Regulations. As a reminder, this information is updated for all US states at once.

Blasts: As usual, we process many marketing blasts each month to promote our products and services. This month our campaigns promoted the Webinar, Abenity benefits for Justia Connect members, our Justia Premium Placements, and of course our regular newsletters and automated reports for Justia Elevate, Justia Amplify, and Justia Connect.

Data Team Reports: Our Data Team continues delivering business knowledge through automated reports. This month they are releasing a JLD analysis that is always up to date. They also brought insights into our cloud infrastructure costs identifying areas of opportunity and action items.

Justia, SCCLA, and NAPABA: These are the first two of many landing pages we have designed to build relationships with various bar associations. Check out the pages at the URLs above.

Server Maintenances: Our IT Team took care of several server maintenances this month. Some of the properties involved in the upkeep were Justia Dockets, our Latin America Countries' website, and the infrastructure currently hosting our new version of Justia Jobs.

Laravel 9 Repository Starter: This is another deliverable you won’t notice, but we have released a new version of our development projects starter that will allow us to use the latest and best version of our main application framework.

JUSTIA PORTAL NEWS

Take a Look at the Ongoing Development of Our Consumer Portal
  • 50-State Surveys. We wrote a new survey on legal separation laws in divorce for the Divorce center. We are also working on updates to our alimony survey in the same center.
  • Additional Snippets. We have improved the accessibility and clarity of the Health Care Law center and Small Business center by writing more snippets emphasizing critical points in these areas.
  • Child Safety Center. We completed a new center of about 50 pages for our Justia Legal Guides on child safety in homes, schools, vehicles, and online while discussing related legal issues.

Justia Pet News

Keeping Up With Kirbie

Kirbie is Marina's five-year-old English Bulldog, already counting down to her next birthday pawty! She spends her days snoring through Mom's meetings and snacking on her favorite treats. In addition to waddling around the house, Kirbie loves to go for a ride in the car - just don't tell her it is to the puppy hotel!

TEAM ACTIVITIES

Justia Hackathon 2022 - Winners

We are excited to report that the second edition of the Justia Hackathon was a huge success! We are also glad to see the results and congratulate all the winners in the different categories. It is good to know that many people met to work on collaborative projects and learn about various technologies. Congratulations, and thank you for achieving new and amazing things as a team!

Winners of each category:

Upcoming Holidays

DID YOU KNOW?

Justia Wins 2022 LegalTech Breakthrough Award For “Legal Education Innovation of the Year”

Last month, Justia was awarded the 2022 LegalTech Breakthrough Award For “Legal Education Innovation of the Year” for our recently launched Justia U.S. Law School Center. Our whole team is very proud of this recognition and looks forward to it serving its purpose of free access to the law with tailored resources for law students. Go Justia!

Justia at the NAPABA Convention

Justia attended the 2022 National Asian Pacific American Bar Association (NAPABA) Convention in Las Vegas. Our team spoke with the attendees about Justia's mission and the Justia Portal and provided insights about all our Justia Marketing Solutions. During the event, several lawyers claimed their free Justia Profile in the Justia Lawyer Directory and participated in a raffle for some Apple products. Undoubtedly, a great experience for Justia and an excellent opportunity to continue building Brand Awareness of our free law initiatives and our marketing solutions for lawyers and law firms.

REVIEWS & RECOMMENDATIONS

Joan of Arc by Mark Twain

Available on Amazon

"A 16-year-old nobody girl shows up. Possibly experiencing bipolar disorder episodes, she begins to "hear voices" that lead her to the lost sword, find, and crown her King, raise an army, chew bubble gum, and kick butt. Unfortunately for the English, she’s out of gum. Mark Twain writes the definitive story on Joan of Arc that no movie has come close to capturing. Also, I was serious about the gum."

- John Pruitt

Collaborators: Alejandra Medina, Alejandro Moreno, Arturo Jara, Erika Azuela, Haydee Garcia, Jose Ramos, Lauren Moskie, Miguel Berlanga, Rene Peralta, and Zoraida Vallejo.
